result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan Tyler Jones

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:34 AM Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Jordan Tyler Jones. Attorney appears by authorization. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Broze. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense received an offer and is trying to negotiate with the State, and is awaiting to see if other charges will be filed. 
State confirms 2 referrals are under review, but unsure if charges will be filed. DDA Ted Szczupakiewicz is reviewing. 
Court sets another date.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:59 AM Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Jordan Tyler Jones. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Authorization to appear received and filed. 

Atty Bronze has now received all discovery but is waiting for an offer, and requests another date. 
State forwards offer to the Defense.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Authorization to appear received and filed.

Hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abigail Kincheloe, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jordan Tyler Jones in court.   

Defendant doesn't qualify for public defender representation.
Defendant is requesting the court appoint counsel.
Court swears in the defendant.
Court conducts colloquy with the defendant.

Court denies the defendant's request for court representation.
Defendant will need to retain private counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

signed and filed by defendant.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 5/23/2022 - I will need to address this when the defendant is in court. I am not sure that he can be considered partially indigent.**

posted at the Sheriff's dept

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Increasing the bond that was signed this weekend.

01:57 PM Defendant Jordan Tyler Jones in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim A appearing in court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
